Short-Form Award
For most awarded issues, the short-form rating narrative is sufficient.  Using text generated by selections made in VBMS-R, the embedded glossaries and tools, and limited free text, explain the essential components of the decision as listed in
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, 1.A.5.a
.
Note
:  When awarding SC in the short-form narrative style, discussion of specific treatment in service or post-service is not necessary.  Simply citing the legal basis for awarding SC and the symptoms that are the basis of the assigned evaluation is sufficient.
References
:  For more information on
mandatory use of VBMS-R embedded rules-based tools, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, 1.A.5.c
addressing favorable findings in the rating narrative, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, 1.A.5.h
use of free text in a rating narrative, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, 1.A.6.b
an example of an award in the short-form rating narrative style, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, 1.A.6.d
, and
claims requiring the use of a long-form rating narrative, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, 1.A.7.a
.
